page.title: 15The College of Agriculture
page.content: Pencoed College of Agriculture is just off the Pencoed by-pass. At the college they milk cows and keep sheep. It is hard working at the college, but it is not as hard as it used to be. There are five-people working on the farm and twenty-five people working in the college. At the college about five-hundred students learn about farming. It is a big place which covers two-hundred and twenty acres. It is sixty-five years old and consists of twenty rooms altogether,on two floors. The students have to work five days a week, and each person works six hours a day. At the college people learn about agriculture, horticulture, flower arranging, forestry and farm machinery. The improvements that the staff would like to see are more animals, and more plants grown there.
